data.title: Dr. Carole Jackson
data.meta_description: Dr. Carole Jackson is a member of the American College of OB-GYN, Arkansas Medical Society,​ and the Faulkner County Medical Society.
data.text:
Dr. Carole Jackson was born and raised in Nashville, AR. She knew she wanted to go into medicine at an early age, having been inspired by a teacher in elementary school. She also has family members who are in the medical profession.

For her, the decision to be an OB-GYN physician is due to the diversity of the practice. She gets to see patients in the clinic, perform surgery and of course she enjoys delivering babies.

She obtained her undergraduate degree at the University of Arkansas and then completed medical school and residency at UAMS. She has special training in the Da Vinci robot and the MonaLisa Touch laser. She is a member of the American College of OB-GYN, Arkansas Medical Society and the Faulkner County Medical Society.

Dr. Carole Jackson has three grown sons. She spends her spare time cooking, gardening, reading, watching the Hogs and enjoys volunteering with the St. Joseph Christian ladies. She was chosen as Women’s Inc Reader Choice Award, Favorite OB-GYN runner up.
